title: Koch Snowflake
description: An interactive MicroSim demonstrating the Koch snowflake fractal with adjustable recursion depth and size controls.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Mathematics
Geometry
Fractals
learningObjectives: Understand the concept of recursive geometric patterns
Observe how simple rules can generate complex shapes
Explore the relationship between recursion depth and visual complexity
Appreciate the mathematical properties of fractals

controls.name: recursionSlider
controls.label: Recursion Level
controls.description: Controls the depth of fractal recursion. Higher values create more detailed snowflakes.

controls.name: sizeSlider
controls.label: Size
controls.description: Adjusts the overall size of the snowflake within the canvas.

equations: Perimeter at level n: P(n) = P(0) * (4/3)^n
Number of segments at level n: S(n) = 3 * 4^(n-1)
limitations: Maximum recursion level of 6 to prevent performance issues
